byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden and Laure Fourquet contributed reporting from Paris.
byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and MAÏA de la BAUME

abstract: Seynes-les-Alps, France, mountain village that is vacation destination for hikers and rock climbers, has become place of mourning and staging ground for recovery operations following crash of Germanwings jet; rescue personnel are struggling to find ways to reach crash site, which is on steep hillside.
lead_paragraph: The crash site is inaccessible by road or even foot, making helicopter flights the only way in, and most of the area is covered by steep hillside.

headline.main: Challenges Weigh Heavily on Recovery Efforts in Germanwings Crash
headline.print_headline: From Mountain Haven to a Place of Mourning

snippet: The crash site is inaccessible by road or even foot, making helicopter flights the only way in, and most of the area is covered by steep hillside.
